result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby L Ostrum #310541 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligation owed is to be paid from all funds received into defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Undergo an evaluation for trauma & comply with any treatment recommendations.
.

records.addlTxt:
Def in custody w/atty Waterman
  Victim Impact statement filed
Written explanation of determinate sentence filed
CRT: Ct1: sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence 7 years 6 months
INITIAL CONFINEMENT: 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS w/credit for 227 days
Def is eligible for CIP & ERP
EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 4 YEARS w/cond: AODA & comply, no alcohol or CS w/random testing, no contact w/drug users/dealers,  any other assess deemed approp by PO, undergo eval for trauma & comply, pay rest + 10% surcharge to B.G. for $673.75, pay DOC + Supervision fees
Ct4: sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence 3 years concurrent w/Ct1
INITIAL CONFINEMENT: 1 YEAR
EXTENDED SUPERVISON: 2 YEARS
assigned PO Dayna Albitz

9:15 AM  -  Def in court w/ Atty Gregg Earl Waterman.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
WATERMAN: He's entered pleas and sentencing is a week from Monday and the PSI has been rec'd and theres a prison recommendation. Asking for release w/ the prospect of him con't in custody he has a couple practical matters he would like to clear up b/f transfer to Dodge. SKEMP: object to the request. He was an obsconer on probation when arrested for this charge. I sympathize w/ his plight but those same things apply to many in jail and they have to make alternate arrangements. I believe he's a  risk to flee and commit crimes. This hadn't been charged but goes to his character. We have recorded calls of him conspiracing w/ T.C to get rid of J. K car. He was intimidating - this is his behavior while in custody. I think releasing him puts the public safety at risk. CRT: the conditions warranted a cash bond still exist  - since the bond was set there's now a conviction and bond is discretionary. We have had the bene of the PSI recommending WSP which reinforces the bond in the first place. the Mtn to modify the bond is DENIED

Waterman requests continuance of up to a month.  Received PSI yesterday.
Def just reviewed it.
Court: Set over 30 days - get a date and time.
Sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

From: Atty Waterman Re: copy of def's "Goals & plan for Release" along w/ltrs from Jail program coord, Project proven instructor, Ashley Furniture, certificate of completion Project Proven, Cert of completion Active Parenting Now
SLH: noted

Def in court w/ Atty Gregg Earl Waterman.  Def in custody.  Brian Keith Barton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
WATERMAN: his sentencing is  6/14. He's been in custody since 12/6/15. BARTON: state requested the cash bond that was imposed. The agmt was no commitment to sentencing but defer to the results of the PSI.  WATERMAN: the PO met w/ him for about 3 hrs in prep of the PSI. CRT: the hx is substantial one. I don't believe modification is warranted at this time. If the DOC would indicate they were leaning toward probation, I would give that greater weight.
to modify bond
